intro: Manglietia sapaensis, commonly known as the Sapa manglietia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils within primary and secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
